de.mrapp.android.validation

Interface Validateable<Type>

  • Type Parameters:
    Type - The type of the values, which should be validated
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractValidateableView, EditText, PasswordEditText, Spinner

    public interface Validateable<Type>
    Defines the interface, a view, whose value should be able to be validated, must implement.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAllValidators(java.util.Collection<Validator<Type>> validators)
      Adds all validators, which are contained by a specific collection.
      void addAllValidators(Validator<Type>... validators)
      Adds all validators, which are contained by a specific array.
      void addValidationListener(ValidationListener<Type> listener)
      Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the view has been validated.
      void addValidator(Validator<Type> validator)
      Adds a new validator, which should be used to validate the view's value.
      java.util.Collection<Validator<Type>> getValidators()
      Returns a collection, which contains all validators, which are used to validate the view's value.
      boolean isValidatedOnFocusLost()
      Returns, whether the value of the view is automatically validated, when the view loses its focus, or not.
      boolean isValidatedOnValueChange()
      Returns, whether the value of the view is automatically validated, when its value has been changed, or not.
      void removeAllValidators()
      Removes all validators.
      void removeAllValidators(java.util.Collection<Validator<Type>> validators)
      Removes all validators, which are contained by a specific collection.
      void removeAllValidators(Validator<Type>... validators)
      Removes all validators, which are contained by a specific array.
      void removeValidationListener(ValidationListener<Type> listener)
      Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the view has been validated, anymore.
      void removeValidator(Validator<Type> validator)
      Removes a specific validator, which should not be used to validate the view's value, anymore.
      boolean validate()
      Validates the current value of the view.
      void validateOnFocusLost(boolean validateOnFocusLost)
      Sets, whether the value of the view should automatically be validated, when the view loses its focus, or not.
      void validateOnValueChange(boolean validateOnValueChange)
      Sets, whether the value of the view should automatically be validated, when its value has been changed, or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getValidators

        java.util.Collection<Validator<Type>> getValidators()
        Returns a collection, which contains all validators, which are used to validate the view's value. The validators are applied in the given order.
        Returns:
        A collection, which contains the validators, which are used to validate the view's value, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no views are used to validate the view's value

      • addValidator

        void addValidator(Validator<Type> validator)
        Adds a new validator, which should be used to validate the view's value. The validators are applied in the order, they have been added to the view.
        Parameters:
        validator - The validator, which should be added, as an instance of the type Validator. The validator may not be null

      • addAllValidators

        void addAllValidators(java.util.Collection<Validator<Type>> validators)
        Adds all validators, which are contained by a specific collection. The validators are applied in the given order.
        Parameters:
        validators - A collection, which contains the validators, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no validators should be added

      • addAllValidators

        void addAllValidators(Validator<Type>... validators)
        Adds all validators, which are contained by a specific array. The validators are applied in the given order.
        Parameters:
        validators - An array, which contains the validators, which should be added, as an array of the type Validator or an empty array, if no validators should be added

      • removeValidator

        void removeValidator(Validator<Type> validator)
        Removes a specific validator, which should not be used to validate the view's value, anymore.
        Parameters:
        validator - The validator, which should be removed, as an instance of the type Validator. The validator may not be null

      • removeAllValidators

        void removeAllValidators(java.util.Collection<Validator<Type>> validators)
        Removes all validators, which are contained by a specific collection.
        Parameters:
        validators - A collection, which contains the validators, which should be removed, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no validators should be removed

      • removeAllValidators

        void removeAllValidators(Validator<Type>... validators)
        Removes all validators, which are contained by a specific array.
        Parameters:
        validators - An array, which contains the validators, which should be removed, as an array of the type Validator or an empty array, if no validators should be removed

      • removeAllValidators

        void removeAllValidators()
        Removes all validators.

      • validate

        boolean validate()
        Validates the current value of the view.
        Returns:
        True, if the current value is valid, false otherwise

      • isValidatedOnValueChange

        boolean isValidatedOnValueChange()
        Returns, whether the value of the view is automatically validated, when its value has been changed, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the value of the view is automatically validated, when its value has been changed, false otherwise

      • validateOnValueChange

        void validateOnValueChange(boolean validateOnValueChange)
        Sets, whether the value of the view should automatically be validated, when its value has been changed, or not.
        Parameters:
        validateOnValueChange - True, if the value of the view should automatically be validated, when its value has been changed, false otherwise

      • isValidatedOnFocusLost

        boolean isValidatedOnFocusLost()
        Returns, whether the value of the view is automatically validated, when the view loses its focus, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the value of the view is automatically validated, when the view loses its focus, false otherwise

      • validateOnFocusLost

        void validateOnFocusLost(boolean validateOnFocusLost)
        Sets, whether the value of the view should automatically be validated, when the view loses its focus, or not.
        Parameters:
        validateOnFocusLost - True, if the value of the view should automatically be validated, when the view loses its focus, false otherwise

      • addValidationListener

        void addValidationListener(ValidationListener<Type> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the view has been validated.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type ValidationListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeValidationListener

        void removeValidationListener(ValidationListener<Type> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the view has been validated, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type ValidationListener. The listener may not be null
